column4: can anyone help me out here? I'm on feisty with ATI...and when I run beryl, it causes my taskbar to disappear
KDE?
gnome
probably a nasty bug, try running gnome-panel (i think thats the command, don't use gnome anymore)
so just go to the terminal and type in gnome-panel?
ehrm do a ps -e | grep panel
what does it return (Im taking a guess you have a panel right now)
5361 ?        00:00:02 gnome-panel
ok, then you try beryl and open gnome-panel
also you can start apps using ALT-
ALT-
sorry, ALT+F2
thought it was working for a second
so you opened it and crashed?
no I opened beryl and all the effect changed, but my taskbars disappeared again
I tried killall gnome-panel
so did you executed the gnome-panel as I suggested?
yeah...and it shows me this: I've detected a panel already running, and will now exit
if I'm doing things wrong I apologize...I'm pretty new to all of this
np, maybe you didn't killed it correctly? did you tried it with sudo?
like: "sudo gnome-panel"
or "sudo killall gnome-panel"
